description: Use the scripting API to execute script in different contexts.

functions.description: Injects a script into a target context. The script will be run at document_idle.
functions.name: executeScript

parameters.description: The details of the script which to inject.
parameters.name: injection

parameters.description: Invoked upon completion of the injection. The resulting array contains the result of execution for each frame where the injection succeeded.
parameters.name: callback

functions.description: Inserts a CSS stylesheet into a target context. If multiple frames are specified, unsuccessful injections are ignored.
functions.name: insertCSS

parameters.description: The details of the styles to insert.
parameters.name: injection

parameters.description: Invoked upon completion of the injection.
parameters.name: callback

functions.description: Removes a CSS stylesheet that was previously inserted by this extension from a target context.
functions.name: removeCSS

parameters.description: The details of the styles to remove. Note that the css, files, and origin properties must exactly match the stylesheet inserted through insertCSS. Attempting to remove a non-existent stylesheet is a no-op.
parameters.name: injection

parameters.description: Invoked upon completion of the injection.
parameters.name: callback

functions.description: Registers one or more content scripts for this extension.
functions.name: registerContentScripts

parameters.description: Contains a list of scripts to be registered. If there are errors during script parsing/file validation, or if the IDs specified already exist, then no scripts are registered.
parameters.name: scripts

parameters.description: Invoked upon completion of the registration.
parameters.name: callback

functions.description: Returns all dynamically registered content scripts for this extension that match the given filter.
functions.name: getRegisteredContentScripts

parameters.description: An object to filter the extension's dynamically registered scripts.
parameters.name: filter

parameters.description: The resulting array contains the registered content scripts.
parameters.name: callback

functions.description: Unregisters one or more content scripts for this extension.
functions.name: unregisterContentScripts

parameters.description: If specified, only unregisters dynamic content scripts which match the filter. Otherwise, all of the extension's dynamic content scripts are unregistered.
parameters.name: filter

parameters.description: Invoked upon completion of the unregistration.
parameters.name: callback

functions.description: Updates one or more content scripts for this extension.
functions.name: updateContentScripts

parameters.description: Contains a list of scripts to be updated. If there are errors during script parsing/file validation, or if the IDs specified do not already exist, then no scripts are updated.

items.description: An object that represents a content script registered programmatically

functions.description: Unregister a content script registered programmatically
functions.name: unregister

persistAcrossSessions.description: Specifies if this content script will persist into future sessions.

parameters.name: scripts

parameters.description: Invoked when scripts have been updated.
parameters.name: callback

args.description: The arguments to curry into a provided function. This is only valid if the func parameter is specified. These arguments must be JSON-serializable.

files.description: The path of the JS files to inject, relative to the extension's root directory. Exactly one of files and func must be specified.

func.description: A JavaScript function to inject. This function will be serialized, and then deserialized for injection. This means that any bound parameters and execution context will be lost. Exactly one of files and func must be specified.

injectImmediately.description: Whether the injection should be triggered in the target as soon as possible (but not necessarily prior to page load).

target.description: Details specifying the target into which to inject the script.

error.description: The error property is set when the script execution failed. The value is typically an (Error) object with a message property, but could be any value (including primitives and undefined) if the script threw or rejected with such a value.

frameId.description: The frame ID associated with the injection.

result.description: The result of the script execution.

allFrames.description: Whether the script should inject into all frames within the tab. Defaults to false. This must not be true if frameIds is specified.

frameIds.description: The IDs of specific frames to inject into.

tabId.description: The ID of the tab into which to inject.

css.description: A string containing the CSS to inject. Exactly one of files and css must be specified.

files.description: The path of the CSS files to inject, relative to the extension's root directory. Exactly one of files and css must be specified.

origin.description: The style origin for the injection. Defaults to 'AUTHOR'.

target.description: Details specifying the target into which to inject the CSS.

ids.description: The IDs of specific scripts to retrieve with getRegisteredContentScripts() or to unregister with unregisterContentScripts().

types.description: The JavaScript world for a script to execute within. ISOLATED is the default execution environment of content scripts, MAIN is the web page's execution environment.

allFrames.description: If specified true, it will inject into all frames, even if the frame is not the top-most frame in the tab. Each frame is checked independently for URL requirements; it will not inject into child frames if the URL requirements are not met. Defaults to false, meaning that only the top frame is matched.

css.description: The list of CSS files to be injected into matching pages. These are injected in the order they appear in this array.

excludeMatches.description: Excludes pages that this content script would otherwise be injected into.

id.description: The id of the content script, specified in the API call.

js.description: The list of JavaScript files to be injected into matching pages. These are injected in the order they appear in this array.

matchOriginAsFallback.description: If matchOriginAsFallback is true, then the code is also injected in about:, data:, blob: when their origin matches the pattern in 'matches', even if the actual document origin is opaque (due to the use of CSP sandbox or iframe sandbox). Match patterns in 'matches' must specify a wildcard path glob. By default it is false.

matches.description: Specifies which pages this content script will be injected into. Must be specified for registerContentScripts().

persistAcrossSessions.description: Specifies if this content script will persist into future sessions. Defaults to true.

runAt.description: Specifies when JavaScript files are injected into the web page. The preferred and default value is document_idle.

world.description: The JavaScript world for a script to execute within. Defaults to "ISOLATED".
